snippet: Pakistan closed NATO’s supply routes across its border in November after an American airstrike mistakenly killed 24 Pakistani soldiers at a frontier outpost.
abstract: Pakistan’s closing of NATO’s ground supply routes to Afghanistan has added about $100 million a month to the costs of the Afghan war, Defense Secretary Leon E Panetta tells Congress; country closed routes across its border in November after an American airstrike mistakenly killed 24 Pakistani soldiers at a frontier outpost.
lead_paragraph: Pakistan closed NATO’s supply routes across its border in November after an American airstrike mistakenly killed 24 Pakistani soldiers at a frontier outpost.

headline.main: Pakistan: Supply Detour Costs $100 Million a Month
headline.print_headline: Pakistan: Supply Detour Costs $100 Million a Month
